title: 820-2915-B works with fake charger/PSU
message:
Hello
I tried with known good 85W adapter and no battery installed, any help?

title: 820-2915-B works with fake charger/PSU
message:
Post U7000 basic voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27 (with original charger).
Also check resistance (ohm scale) between pins 17/18 and 27/28.

Did you try SMC bypass?

title: 820-2915-B works with fake charger/PSU
message:
1    CHGR_AGATE: 0V

2    CHGR_DCIN: 15.6,

3    CHGR_ACIN: 3.9V

9    CHGR_AMON:0V

12    PP3V42_G3H: 3.46

13    CHGR_RST_L: 3.46

14    SMC_BC_ACOK: 3.3V

15    CHGR_BMON: 0V

16    CHGR_BGATE: 5.2V

17    CHGR_CSO_N: 12.53

19    PP5V1_CHGR_VDD: 5V

20    PP5V1_CHGR_VDDP: 5V

27    CHGR_CSI_N: 16.2V

pins 17/18: 2.8 Ohm
27/28: 20.4 ohm

title: 820-2915-B works with fake charger/PSU
message: SMC BYPASS works with original 85w  adapter (board turn on and fan full speed)

title: 820-2915-B works with fake charger/PSU
message:
So you get correct PPBUS_G3H even with original charger.

There must be a sensor issue.
Check SMC_DCIN/PBUS_VSENSE.

title: 820-2915-B works with fake charger/PSU
message:
There should be something else on this board...

Now I dont have green light with PSU,
PPBUS_G3H: 1V

I thought I shorted U7000, so replaced it, I had green light for some minutes and now I cant get green light again

title: 820-2915-B works with fake charger/PSU
message:
By checking SMC DCIN, I noticed that 

SMC_BC_ACOK: 3.3V BUT IT has a pulse to 0 every 400mS (PP3V42_G3H is stable) 

SMC BC AC OK pulsing doesnt happen with the PSU

title: 820-2915-B works with fake charger/PSU
message: Did you check mentioned VSENSE sensors???

title: 820-2915-B works with fake charger/PSU
message: Fixed by changin DC in board...
